intro: Senecio alaskanus, commonly known as Alaska groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are usually woolly and gray-green in color, while its stems are often hairless. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Senecio alaskanus thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
